intro: Cabralea lagoensis, commonly known as the Lagoense Cabralea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
